result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP

records.addlTxt:
10:03 a.m.Defendant MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP in court, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP.  Prosecuting attorney Eric Sparr in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to be filed. Bond continues.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Court allows contact with Taytanna Campbell.

11:00 AM Defendant MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information received by Defendant, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea.   Motion to modify bond - granted.  Court lifts no contact with Taytanna Campbell.  All other conditions remain the same.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:46 AM Defendant MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for MICHAEL T. MOLENKAMP.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @  948
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
